text:
e="preserve">"This is about the town in Kansas, USA. For other towns called Tipton, see Tipton (disambiguation)."
Tipton is a city in Mitchell County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 210 people lived there.
History.
Tipton was first called Pittsburg. It was created as Pittsburg in 1872. The people realized that another Pittsburg existed in Kansas, so they changed the name to Tipton. It was named after Tipton, Iowa, the former home of a local resident.
Geography.
Tipton is at (39.339380, -98.470155). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 210 people, 98 households, and 57 families living in Tipton.
